title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 186-3.4 - Temporary child performer permit
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 186-3.4 - Temporary child performer permit

State Regulations
(a) Prior to the first employment of a child
performer, the commissioner may issue a temporary child performer permit in
order to give the parent or guardian of the child performer time to establish a
child performer trust account or to produce all documentation required by the
department for the issuance of a child performer permit. (b) A temporary child performer permit shall
be valid for 15 days from the date of issuance. (c) A temporary child performer permit may be
issued only once for a given child. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
186-3.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
